In this case, the President has overreached — and is doing so for unacceptable political reasons.  Democrats and Republicans agree: We all need to do more to protect our borders, but the President needs to work with us, not just take unilateral action.

National emergencies are no way to govern, and, worse, we can’t afford to take resources from the Pentagon and programs vital to protecting our service members and our national security. Congress has a clearly delineated Constitutional role and so does the President.
